title: Vegan Chana Saag
description: A hearty, fragrant Indian-inspired curry combining tender chickpeas and wilted spinach in a spiced tomato-onion base. Bright, earthy flavors from garam masala, cumin, and ginger balance creamy chickpeas for a satisfying plant-based meal served with rice or flatbreads.

ingredients.notes: drain and rinse if using canned; if using cooked from dry, use ~360 g cooked

ingredients.display_name: fresh spinach (packed) or chopped frozen spinach (thawed, squeezed)
ingredients.notes: about 10 oz fresh equals roughly 8 cups loosely packed before wilting

ingredients.display_name: tomato, canned crushed or fresh finely chopped

ingredients.notes: toast briefly in oil at start

ingredients.display_name: red chili powder (or paprika for milder)
ingredients.notes: adjust to taste; optional for mild version
stir in near end for aroma

steps.text: Prep all ingredients: finely chop onion, mince garlic and ginger, measure spices, drain and rinse chickpeas, wash and roughly chop spinach if using fresh.
Heat oil in a large skillet or sauté pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle until fragrant (about a few seconds) but not burned.
Add the chopped onion and a pinch of salt; sauté until softened and translucent, stirring frequently.
Stir in minced garlic and ginger and cook until aromatic, about one minute, taking care not to brown the garlic.
Add ground coriander, turmeric and red chili powder (if using). Toast the spices with the aromatics for about 30–45 seconds to bloom the flavors.
Pour in the crushed tomatoes and simmer for 4–5 minutes, breaking down any large pieces and reducing raw tomato flavor; stir occasionally.
Add the drained chickpeas and water or vegetable broth, stir to combine, then bring to a gentle simmer. Cook uncovered for 6–8 minutes so the chickpeas absorb the sauce.
Fold in the chopped fresh spinach (or squeezed thawed frozen spinach) in batches, allowing it to wilt between additions; stir until fully incorporated.
Once the spinach is wilted and the sauce is slightly thickened, stir in garam masala, lemon juice and adjust salt. Simmer 1–2 minutes to meld flavors.
Taste and adjust seasoning (salt, lemon, chili). Finish with chopped cilantro if using, then remove from heat and let rest briefly before serving.
